title: Bring Beachy Vibes To Any Room With These Textural Finishes + Furniture Picks
description: There’s something about a beach house filled with natural timbers, rattan furniture, and woven designs that offers a sense of escapism from the moment you step inside. But if you’re not actually heading to a beach house this summer, why not bring some of the seaside vibes to your own home? Below, shop our edit of furniture, finishes, and homewares from our Design Directory to celebrate the best of coastal styling!
author: The Design Files
excerpt: Love rattan, timber and woven furniture? Explore our shopping guide to the best coastal-inspired pieces for your home.
text: What does your dream beach house look like? For us, it would have a pared-back material palette, lots of timber, and woven furniture inside. And ideally, it would have a view of the ocean! This earthy and warm version of coastal style is something we see reflected in many of our favourite home tours in our archive — regardless of their location. In fact, you can bring a taste of this beachy vibe to any space with the right pieces. One way to do so is simply by playing with varying natural textures. This might be through your interior fixtures, such as installing sun-kissed-looking timbers, like the White Smoked Oak Floorboards by Royal Oak Flooring or using Laminex’s Raw Birchply on the joinery. Timber-lined walls also immediately fill a room with calming energy, evoking memories of retro holiday homes. But if you prefer a light-and-bright backdrop, a woven jute rug like Sequoia by Armadillo is a more subtle way to inject texture into a room with crisp white walls. Woven furniture and rattan accents are other classic coastal-look staples that can easily add plenty of rich, lived-in character without having to tackle any renovation. In the living room, we can’t go past the Thonet’s No.811 Hoffmann chair, which pairs a sophisticated bentwood frame with a hand-woven cane seat, or the statement curves of the Gubi Grace Easy Chair from Cult. Vintage-inspired rattan lamps are also really having a moment. We love how the soft linen lamp shade of La Bobine Table Lamp by ELLISON STUDIOS. complements with the eye-catching base. Visit The Design Directory to discover our top picks in flooring, furniture, lighting and more!
html:
What does your dream beach house look like?

For us, it would have a pared-back material palette, lots of timber, and woven furniture inside. And ideally, it would have a view of the ocean!

This earthy and warm version of coastal style is something we see reflected in many of our favourite home tours in our archive — regardless of their location.

In fact, you can bring a taste of this beachy vibe to any space with the right pieces.

One way to do so is simply by playing with varying natural textures. This might be through your interior fixtures, such as installing sun-kissed-looking timbers, like the White Smoked Oak Floorboards by Royal Oak Flooring or using Laminex’s Raw Birchply on the joinery.

Timber-lined walls also immediately fill a room with calming energy, evoking memories of retro holiday homes.

But if you prefer a light-and-bright backdrop, a woven jute rug like Sequoia by Armadillo is a more subtle way to inject texture into a room with crisp white walls.

Woven furniture and rattan accents are other classic coastal-look staples that can easily add plenty of rich, lived-in character without having to tackle any renovation.

In the living room, we can’t go past the Thonet’s No.811 Hoffmann chair, which pairs a sophisticated bentwood frame with a hand-woven cane seat, or the statement curves of the Gubi Grace Easy Chair from Cult.

Vintage-inspired rattan lamps are also really having a moment. We love how the soft linen lamp shade of La Bobine Table Lamp by ELLISON STUDIOS. complements with the eye-catching base.

Visit The Design Directory to discover our top picks in flooring, furniture, lighting and more!
